docblock.description: Class definition for \Altamira\Chart
This class encapsulates all behavior around charts.
docblock.long-description: It's responsible for keeping track data and configurations and transmitting the appropriate information to its JsWriter. Each chart has its own JsWriter instance.

docblock.description: Used as a unique identifier in code.
docblock.long-description: Will be post-processed, but should be treated using variable naming conventions.

docblock.long-description: Keys include series names as well as 'default'.

Class definition for \Altamira\ChartDatum\Bubble
Class for abstracting bubble chart data.
Constructor method
Returns an array that corresponds with the ultimate JSON data needed for this datum
Class definition for \Altamira\ChartDatum\BubbleFactory
Responsible for creating instances of \Altamira\ChartDatum\Bubble
Returns an array of results provided an array of arrays of four values -- label, x, y, and radius.
docblock.long-description:
This means that an array should be formatted as follows:

array( 'this is my label', 10, 20, 15 )

Where the label is "this is my label", the point at the center of the bubble is located at {10, 20}, and the radius of the bubble is 15.

tag.name: param
tag.description: provided if you have an existing array of ChartDatum instances you want to append to

docblock.description: Class definition for \Altamira\ChartDatum\TwoDimensionalPointFactory
Responsible for creating instances of \Altamira\ChartDatum\TwoDimensionalPoint
Transforms a one-dimensional array to x,y points.
docblock.long-description:
Adds one to each X value as array index. Y value is array value. Passing an array will append the results to an existing array. In other words, providing the following array:

array( 5, 10, 15, 20, 25 )

will yield the following coordinates (as {x,y}):

[{1,5}, {2,10}, {3,15}, {4,20}, {5,25}]

For more freedom over points, use getFromNested.

docblock.description: Transforms a one-dimensional array to x,y points.
docblock.long-description:
Adds one to each Y value as array index. X value is array value. Passing an array will append the results to an existing array. In other words, providing the following array:

array( 5, 10, 15, 20, 25 )

will yield the following coordinates (as {x,y}):

[{5,1}, {10,2}, {15,3}, {20,4}, {25,5}]

For more freedom over value relationships, use getFromNested.

docblock.description: Transforms an array of arrays into points using the first two array values of each nested array.
docblock.long-description:
Passing an array will append the results to an existing array. Therefore, you providing the following array:

array( array( 10, 8 ), array( 11, 24 ), array( 0.3341, 1551351235 ) )

will yield the following two-dimensional points (as {x,y}):

[{10, 8}, {11, 24}, {0.3341, 1551351235}]

Class definition for \Altamira\Type\Flot\Donut
This type registers a series of chart to be rendered as a donut.
docblock.long-description: Note that this type doesn't accept nesting like in jqplot For the case of Flot, the donut chart is just a hack on top of a pie chart. We could probably do some additional work to nest values, but this seems edge-casey. I would just use JqPlot for donut charts..

Provides a common interface for registering types with charts or series Implementations vary based on library.
docblock.long-description: Types encapsulate logic required to register special rendering cases for series or charts. Registering a type with a series or a chart should cause that series or chart to render as such.
